rules: Rule1: Either the responder has cpr skill or the community has safe status.
Rule2: If the government enacted legislation, then the agency implemented regulation.
Rule3: Provided that the sensor detected an earthquake, the community has safe status.
Rule4: A sensor detected an earthquake or a meteorologist observed a tsunami.
Rule5: Under the condition that the agency confirmed a disaster, if a meteorologist observed a tsunami, then the community has safe status.
Rule6: If the agency approved funding, then it is not the case that the agency denied a request.
Rule7: Whenever resources were allocated for aid, the agency approved funding.
Rule8: Should the agency violate protocol law, then the responder does not have cpr skill.
Rule9: Either the agency violates protocol law or the responder is certified for emergency.
Rule10: Provided that the meteorologist forecasted a hurricane, if the community does not have safe status, then the shelter activated as a facility.
Rule11: Under the condition that the scientist predicted a flood, if the community does not have safe status, then the shelter activated as a facility.

Rule12: Either the agency issued an evacuation or, if it is not the case that either the meteorologist forecasted a hurricane or the scientist predicted a flood, then the warning alert was not ignored.
Rule13: If the government declared an emergency, then should the community not have safe status, emergency communication is established.
Rule14: Under the condition that the agency coordinated relief, if the government did not declare an emergency, then the military activated support.
Rule15: If the insurance denied a claim, then it is not the case that the agency denied a request.
Rule16: Provided that the damage assessment was confirmed, if a citizen filed an appeal, then the insurance denied a claim.
Rule17: If the hazard zone was identified, then should the damage assessment not be confirmed, the reconstruction project is initiated.
Rule18: Under the condition that the risk area was mapped, if the damage assessment was not confirmed, then the reconstruction project is initiated.
Rule19: If the permit for construction was denied, then the agency did not deny a request.
Rule20: If the committee approved the project, then the construction phase was completed.
Rule21: Should the work at the site be halted, then the construction phase was not completed.

Rule22: Either the facility is operational for command or, if it is not the case that the responder being certified for emergency implies the responder does not have cpr skill, then the agency is authorized to use equipment.
Rule23: If the facility has damaged structure, then the facility is not operational for command.
Rule24: Provided that the facility has evacuated personnel, the facility is not operational for command.
Rule25: If the agency declared an emergency, then either the facility has damaged structure or the facility has evacuated personnel.
Rule26: Under the condition that the agency activated a response, the community has safe status.
Rule27: If it is not the case that either the meteorologist forecasted a hurricane or the scientist predicted a flood, then the warning alert was ignored.
Rule28: If it is not the case that either the evacuation of the zone was completed or the agency did not issue an evacuation, then the response was delayed by time.
Rule29: Provided that it is not the case that the responder being certified for emergency implies the responder does not have cpr skill, the agency is not authorized to use equipment.

Rule30: If it is not the case that the negation of either the evacuation of the zone was completed or the agency did not issue an evacuation implies the response was not delayed by time, then the response was accelerated in time.
Rule31: Should it not be the case that the negation of either the hazard zone was identified or the risk area was mapped implies the danger sign was overlooked, then the safety concern is addressed.

Rule32: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of either the hazard zone was identified or the risk area was mapped implies the danger sign was overlooked, the safety concern is not addressed.

Rule33: If it is not the case that the negation of the developer submitting an application implies the permit for construction was denied implies the proposal plan is rejected, then the committee approves the project.
Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that the negation of the agency activating a response implies the agency did not terminate an operation, the government enacted legislation.
Rule35: If the agency did not confirm a disaster, then the agency denied a request.
Rule36: If the agency did not confirm a disaster, then resources were allocated for aid.
Rule37: Should the agency not confirm a disaster, then the citizen filed an appeal.
Rule38: Under the condition that the agency did not confirm a disaster, the developer submitted an application.
Rule39: If the agency did not activate a response, then the agency terminated an operation.
facts: Fact2: The work at the site was halted.
Fact3: The agency declared an emergency.
Fact4: The agency did not implement regulation.
Fact5: The shelter did not activate as a facility.
Fact6: The evacuation of the zone was not completed.
Fact7: The response was not accelerated in time.
Fact8: Emergency communication was not established.
Fact9: The military did not activate support.
Fact10: The reconstruction project was not initiated.
Fact11: The danger sign was not overlooked.
Fact12: The proposal plan was not rejected.
